          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        There have been a bunch of ideas suggested by the reporter. I will try to summarize them<span class="line"><!---->There have been a bunch of ideas suggested by the reporter. I will try to summarize them<!----></span><br><br>1) Misleading filename in <span class="line"><!---->1) Misleading filename in <!----></span>#c17<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c17"><!---->#c17<!----></a> to confuse the user about the origin of the download. This is something that can be a duplicate for the new downloads UX work, where the filename stands out prominently, and is not a part of a sentence that can be misleading.<span class="line"><!----> to confuse the user about the origin of the download. This is something that can be a duplicate for the new downloads UX work, where the filename stands out prominently, and is not a part of a sentence that can be misleading.<!----></span><br><br>2) Using data: URI for initiating a download. I think this is deliberately allowed, and is not a oversight or a bug, see <span class="line"><!---->2) Using data: URI for initiating a download. I think this is deliberately allowed, and is not a oversight or a bug, see <!----></span>issue 594215<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=594215" title="Disable page-initiated main frame navigations to data URLs"><!---->issue 594215<!----></a>. Infact even navigation to data: URI in a new tab is allowed, replicate by visiting <span class="line"><!---->. Infact even navigation to data: URI in a new tab is allowed, replicate by visiting <!----></span>https://bayden.com/test/data.htm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bayden.com/test/data.htm"><!---->https://bayden.com/test/data.htm<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> right click and open a data URI page in a new tab.<span class="line"><!----> right click and open a data URI page in a new tab.<!----></span><br>I do not think banning data: URI for downloads, even if just for executables can be considered till there is data backing up about the prevelance of this mechanism, its ability to bypass safe browsing checks, and the impact on the browsing experience if websites cannot use data: URI for downloads.<span class="line"><!---->I do not think banning data: URI for downloads, even if just for executables can be considered till there is data backing up about the prevelance of this mechanism, its ability to bypass safe browsing checks, and the impact on the browsing experience if websites cannot use data: URI for downloads.<!----></span><br><br>3) Not displaying the origin of the website in chrome://downloads. As Min pointed out, we do display the origin of the download, which is the data: URI and is accurate. Changing that adds questionable benefit to security, as the user is likely to open the download without visiting chrome://downloads, and further reporting a URI not of the download, but of the website might just confuse the user.<span class="line"><!---->3) Not displaying the origin of the website in chrome://downloads. As Min pointed out, we do display the origin of the download, which is the data: URI and is accurate. Changing that adds questionable benefit to security, as the user is likely to open the download without visiting chrome://downloads, and further reporting a URI not of the download, but of the website might just confuse the user.<!----></span><br><br>In light of this discussion, I am marking this bug as working as intended.<span class="line"><!---->In light of this discussion, I am marking this bug as working as intended.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
